TITLE: Some newlyweds may face a higher tax bill due to a 'marriage penalty.' What to know
SUMMARY: While many couples discover they benefit tax-wise (or fare the same) once they are married, others end up paying more after tying the knot.

TITLE: House lawmakers relaunch the SALT caucus. Here's what to know about the $10,000 deduction limit for state and local taxes
SUMMARY: A group of bipartisan House representatives relaunched the SALT caucus last week, calling for relief from the $10,000 state and local taxes deduction limit.

TITLE: What laid-off workers need to know when applying for unemployment benefits
SUMMARY: Workers who've recently been impacted by the wave of layoffs from companies should apply for unemployment benefits as soon as possible, experts say.

TITLE: This is the best strategy to pay down credit card debt — but 37% of borrowers don’t know about it
SUMMARY: Moving a balance from a high-rate credit card to one with a no-interest offer can save thousands.

TITLE: As Social Security's full retirement age moves to 67, some experts say it should not go higher
SUMMARY: Raising the full retirement age may be one option on the table to shore up Social Security. Why experts say the idea "doesn't work for this economy."

TITLE: Overpacking, shrinkflation may mean you get less for your money for Valentine's Day gifts this year
SUMMARY: You may get fewer chocolates than you expect in that heart-shaped box this Valentine's Day.

TITLE: Pre-tax vs. Roth 401(k): Deciding which to use for retirement is trickier than you think
SUMMARY: The choice between pre-tax and Roth 401(k) contributions may be trickier than you expect, financial experts say. Here's what to know.

TITLE: IRS says many state rebates aren't taxable at the federal level. Some may face filing struggle, tax pros warn
SUMMARY: The IRS on Friday issued state rebate and payment guidance for millions of filers urged to pause federal filings. Here's what taxpayers need to know.

TITLE: Taylor Swift says fans will 'get on it' to reduce egg prices. Here's why costs are so high
SUMMARY: Trevor Noah joked with pop star Taylor Swift at the Grammys about high egg prices. Here's what to know about prices and when consumers might see relief.

TITLE: Tax pros still in limbo after IRS tells millions who received state rebates to pause filings
SUMMARY: If you received a state tax rebate or payment in 2022, it's unclear whether the funds are taxable on your federal return. Here's what to know.

TITLE: TV prices sink ahead of the Super Bowl — here are the best deals
SUMMARY: Historically, TV prices approach their lowest point right before Super Bowl Sunday. This year, the deals are even better.

TITLE: The hidden price of eggs: How high costs may trickle into other foods
SUMMARY: Retail egg prices are at record highs. Those costs feed into elevated prices for some other groceries, contributing to overall food inflation, economists said.

TITLE: Demise of Biden's student loan forgiveness plan would be 'disastrous blow to Black Americans'
SUMMARY: Black Americans have been hit especially hard by the student loan crisis, meaning they have a lot to lose if the Biden administration's forgiveness plan fails.

TITLE: Nonprofit Making of Black Angels focuses on education to change the face of angel investing
SUMMARY: Angel investors fund companies with high growth potential. Blacks are underrepresented in this world, but there's an effort afoot to open opportunities.

TITLE: Rollovers from a 401(k) plan to an IRA: Weigh these 7 factors first
SUMMARY: A rollover may sound like a simple task. But there are many pros and cons to consider, and mistakes can be costly.

TITLE: These 10 metro areas are the most 'rent burdened' in the U.S. — New York City comes in at No. 1
SUMMARY: New York is the most "rent-burdened" metro area in the U.S., according to a new report from Moody's Analytics.

TITLE: State of the Union brings brief unanimity on Social Security, Medicare. Why experts say there's still reason to worry
SUMMARY: Republicans and Democrats showed their support for Social Security and Medicare during the State of the Union. But agreement on broader reform will be tough.

TITLE: President Biden calls on Congress to crack down on 'junk fees'
SUMMARY: In his State of the Union, Biden called on Congress to pass the Junk Fee Prevention Act to reduce unexpected charges from banks and other service providers.

TITLE: Here are the top 10 states with the cheapest four-year public colleges for in-state students
SUMMARY: If picking a college comes down to the financial bottom line, then an in-state public school is often the best deal.

TITLE: Seniors urge Congress to protect Social Security, Medicare ahead of State of the Union
SUMMARY: Debt ceiling woes have led to fierce debate about the future of Social Security and Medicare and how to approach any possible changes.

TITLE: Wholesale egg prices have 'collapsed.' Why consumers may soon see relief
SUMMARY: Wholesale egg prices have declined by over 50% from their recent record highs. Retail prices may soon follow, but that's not a sure thing.

TITLE: Biden to revisit 'billionaire minimum tax' in State of the Union address
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden will renew his call for a "billionaire minimum tax" during the State of the Union address on Tuesday. Here's what to expect.

TITLE: Auto insurance is up by more than 15% this year in some states. Here's how to keep your premium down
SUMMARY: While the national average for full coverage is up about 2.6%, changes range from a 16.7% jump in Illinois to a 7.2% drop in New Jersey.

TITLE: Valentine's Day spending is set to jump, even if it means more credit card debt
SUMMARY: Consumers are prepared to spend big this Feb. 14, even if it means going into debt, several studies show.

TITLE: Savers poised for 'biggest win' in 2023 as inflation falls. Where to put your cash now
SUMMARY: Savers who have cash set aside in 2023 are poised for a winning combination of rising interest rates and inflation coming down, one expert says.

TITLE: For some, a divorce has a positive effect on their work, study finds
SUMMARY: In a study of people in the process of divorce, a surprisingly high share of respondents said parting with their spouse led them to do better at work.

TITLE: When it makes sense to buy extra paper Series I bonds with your tax refund, according to experts
SUMMARY: You can buy an extra $5,000 in paper Series I bonds with your tax refund, but experts say to consider your goals and weigh alternatives.

TITLE: Roth IRA 'five-year rule' can trigger an unexpected tax bill: Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: Roth IRAs can be a powerful way to save money since withdrawals are generally tax-free in retirement. But a "five-year rule" could trigger a tax bill later.

TITLE: 35% of millionaires say retirement is 'going to take a miracle,' report finds
SUMMARY: Fewer Americans, including millionaires, feel confident about their overall financial well-being.

TITLE: Amid food inflation, more shoppers turn to dollar stores for groceries
SUMMARY: Rising food costs are pushing consumers to get more creative about where they go for groceries.
